ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great Senior Thesis Adviser. Provided lots of insightful direction for my paper.
Great way to explore a topic you're passionate about, but tough to self-motivate. Definitely find a topic you're interested in.
Yes, if you find a topic that you're interested in. Pretty serious commitment, so make sure you have a good one.
Do 2 terms. Much better than 1 term essay.

I wrote a one-term essay and it was a lot of work towards the end. I would not recommend this option unless you have a topic selected and some research done going in. (I did some research over the summer.) That said, writing a senior essay is an awesome experience. Find an adviser who's invested in your success and a topic you're passionate about, and it's a really worthwhile experience.
You either want to write a thesis or you don't want to. It's not required, so maybe you shouldn't.
A senior essay is valuable if you are interested in graduate school. Otherwise, it is simply a waste of time.
Yes, I definitely recommend ECON 491 to anyone passionate about researching a specific topic in economics.
A great experience that any serious econ major should consider.
write a thesis... really weak to not attempt writing one semi-significant in the major
Do it! It isn't mandatory, but you will grow as a person and a scholar.

It's tough, because you need to create your own work schedule, but it's very rewarding if there's something you're really interested in. It's a great opportunity to work closely with a professor and get to experience how a real research project takes shape from start to finish.
Good way to get to know a professor very well. If you don't have a topic, reach out to profs!!
